关于苏丹病毒如何附着在人类细胞上的新见解苏丹病毒是埃博拉病毒的亲戚，死亡率为50％，但就其感染细胞的方式而言仍然很糟糕。目前，尚无批准的治疗。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250204/new-insights-into-how-the-the-sudan-virus-attaches-to-human-cells.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250204/new-insights-into-how-the-the-the-sudan-virus-attaches-to-human-cells.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=A60FF05B-CB14-4A7D-94CA-A78D33F01093 Tue, 04 Feb 2025 14:20:54 -0500 New insights into how the Sudan virus attaches to human cells
UCLA Health获得了172万美元的赠款，以提高脑肿瘤研究和培训加州大学洛杉矶分校卫生局综合癌症中心的调查人员已从美国国立卫生研究院获得172万美元的赠款，以支持Neuro-Oncologology转化研究培训计划，该计划旨在培训下一代脑肿瘤科学家和医师科学家。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250204/ucla-health-receives-241.172亿麦克罗尔 - 麦格恩 - advance-advance-brain-brain-tumor-research-research-risearch-and-training.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250204/ucla-health-receives-2417.2亿格兰特 - 麦克阿特 - advance-advance-brain-brain-tumor-tumor-tumor-tumor-tumor-research-and-training.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=0124c8c2-3e9f-4A46-B36F-4BEB7C4C4F2CDA Tue, 04 Feb 2025 14:17:00 -0500 UCLA Health receives $1.72 million grant to advance brain tumor research and training
